When the wind of Dali blows through the streets, blending the sparkle of Erhai Lake, the tranquility of Cangshan Mountain and the warmth of Bai ethnic life into the architectural texture, this hotel is no longer just a place to stay, but a poetic encounter between nature and humanity, modernity and tradition. From the first glance of surprise at the entrance to the tranquility of the guest rooms, every functional area hides a gentle interpretation of "wind, flower, snow and moon", allowing travelers to understand the romance of Dali in every inch of space.

Rooted in the volcanic and thermal landscape of Tengchong, this hotel design blends Eastern aesthetics with modern luxury. The double-height lobbyâ€™s glazed chandeliers hang like falling stars, with metal grilles and water-patterned glass echoing the layers of volcanic rock, while warm wood tones soften the stoneâ€™s coolness, creating a welcoming space that balances ceremony and relaxation. The restaurant uses semi-transparent metal partitions to define areas, with textured wood and soft pendant lights merging vibrancy and design. The book barâ€™s stacked shelves and central greenery offer a quiet reading retreat; the elevator hallâ€™s landscape carpet and rock installations extend local mountain-water aesthetics. The private garden pool revives Tengchongâ€™s hot spring culture, with pergolas and warm lights framing a relaxing night ambiance, allowing travelers to feel Tengchongâ€™s natural warmth in modern comfort.

ooted in the poetic blue tones of Daliâ€™s Erhai Lake, Lingxin Panhai Seaview Hotel redefines coastal relaxation with minimalist design. The exterior features pure white volumes outlined by warm light strips, resembling a lighthouse by Erhai at dusk. Guest rooms use low-saturation palettes, with arched black-framed windows framing Erhai and Cangshan as a living painting. Textured carpets and pea-green bedding create a cozy ambiance under warm lighting, while single chairs by the view allow guests to embrace sea breezes fully. The rooftop terraceâ€™s white art arches and frame-shaped steps serve as natural viewfinders for sunsets and waves; the restaurant blends tropical greenery with wooden furniture for a Southeast Asian resort vibe, with half-open green-painted shutters letting sea breezes flow through. From architecture to interiors, every design echoes Daliâ€™s romance, making "facing Erhai" an everyday relaxation.

Meika Seaview Hotel redefines coastal getaways with a fresh, light-luxury design language. The exterior features a pure white base, with continuous Mediterranean-inspired arches and trailing greenery creating a relaxed resort vibe, while a red vintage bicycle adds a lively touch. The lobby blends French retro and modern minimalism with black-and-white patterned tiles and color-blocked soft furnishings, illuminated by curved chandeliers and art installations. The restaurant pairs warm-hued tables and chairs with ample natural light, balancing vibrancy and design. Guest rooms use gold lines to frame the TV wall, with pea-green bedding fostering coziness against light wood tones. The corridorâ€™s geometric tiles and curved light strips enhance spatial rhythm, with every detail echoing Erhaiâ€™s clarity and romance, allowing guests to feel Daliâ€™s poetic charm in comfort.

Centered on "youthfulness, ambiance, and photo-worthiness", this light luxury influencer-style hotel redefines travel experiences with color-block aesthetics and avant-garde furnishings. The public area features a hammered metal ceiling paired with caramel art installations, and curved light strips with red-brown color-block sofas create a relaxed social vibe. Guest rooms use macaron pink, mint green, and deep sea blue as main tones, with curved headboards and geometric art installations enhancing visual appeal, while low-saturation soft furnishings and ample natural light balance comfort and design. From the artistic corridor to the cozy guest rooms, every space is both a restful retreat and an Instagram-worthy spot, allowing young travelers to enjoy full-bodied ceremony in comfort.

With the core concept of "Dongchuan Red Soil, Serene Living", this hotel design deeply echoes the plateau landscape and red soil texture of Dongchuan, Yunnan. The outdoor courtyard uses calm, profound paving in deep brown and reddish ochre, paired with local sapium sebiferum and ferns to replicate the heavy texture of red soil. Guest room corridors feature water-patterned glass cylinders framed in dark brown metal, with drought-tolerant greenery, making plateau vitality a spatial narrative. The dining area uses dark wood grille ceilings and reddish ochre walls for a heavy, elegant dining atmosphere. The lobbyâ€™s dark brown metal walls and reddish ochre art installations transform red soil texture into modern sophistication. From outdoor local echoes to indoor calm expression, every detail balances natural texture and modern comfort for an immersive Dongchuan vacation.

With the core concept of "coexistence of nature and avant-garde", this villa redefines the relaxation of contemporary luxury homes with soft curves and color-block aesthetics. The entrance features black-and-white geometric marble flooring paired with a red-glazed art chandelier, framing the courtyard greenery to extend nature into the interior. The double-height living room centers on a caramel-colored linear chandelier, with zebra-patterned carpets and red-green-beige color-blocked soft furnishings creating a vibrant atmosphere, enhanced by curved stairs and art installations. The dining areaâ€™s pink-green color-blocked seats and crystal chandelier infuse art into dining; bedrooms balance comfort and design with low-saturation tones and playful soft furnishings. Overall, softened architectural lines break rigid structures, blending natural materials with avant-garde decor to create a residence with artistic tension and living warmth.

Covering an area of 1600mÂ², we transformed the civil structure and implemented both interior and exterior decoration, both hard and soft. Over three years, we are grateful for the client's trust and cooperation. The interior and exterior, as well as the landscape, are in a new Chinese style. Initially, two double-detached villas were transformed into one, with functions and circulation reorganized. Considering the client's living habits and business needs, we replanned the functions. In the end, we delivered a satisfactory result to the client. The aesthetics, practicality, and functionality are highly aligned with the client's aesthetic, lifestyle, and business activities. After completion, we toasted with the client and had a heart-to-heart talk, which was a moment of happiness and accomplishment.

With Eastern ritual as its core and modern comfort as its spirit, this new Chinese villa redefines the contemporary expression of traditional living. The exterior features overlapping eaves and meander patterns, with a water courtyard creating a poetic ceremony of "viewing water from the courtyard". The corridorâ€™s grilles and palace lanterns let light and shadow evolve with each step, embodying Eastern aesthetics. Interiors blend wooden carved ceilings with marble landscape walls, and flower-and-bird embroidered headboards with low-saturation soft furnishings, transforming traditional motifs into warm modern textures. From the ceremonial entrance to the cozy bedroom, every design balances heritage and innovation, creating a residence with cultural depth and modern comfort.

Rooted in French romance and refined luxury, this villa seamlessly blends classical aesthetics with modern comfort. The public areas feature carved ceilings, Roman columns, and crystal chandeliers that replicate the grandeur of French palaces, while color-block upholstery of caramel velvet sofas and emerald armchairs infuses elegance with vibrancy. Artistic screens with metal lines and marble walls balance vintage charm and modern sophistication. Bedrooms continue the aesthetic, with flower-and-bird embroidered backdrops paired with crystal chandeliers, and velvet bedding and carved furniture making romance part of daily life. From the ceremony of public spaces to the comfort of private areas, every detail creates a residence that balances elegant temperament and cozy living.

ä¸€ä½è€å®¢æˆ·çš„å…¬å¯“ï¼Œè§æƒ¯äº†æµ®åï¼Œè¿½æ±‚ç®€çº¦ä¸å†…å¿ƒå¹³é™ã€‚è®¾è®¡æ—¶ä»¥æµ…æœ¨ä¸æš–ç™½ä¸ºåº•ï¼Œå‹¾å‹’ç°ä»£éƒ½å¸‚çš„æ¾å¼›æ„Ÿã€‚å®¢é¤å¨ä¸€ä½“çš„å¼€æ”¾æ ¼å±€ï¼Œå€Ÿå¤§ç†çŸ³ä¸é‡‘å±çº¿æ¡æå‡ç²¾è‡´åº¦ï¼›å§å®¤ä¸ä¹¦æˆ¿åˆ™å›å½’æŸ”å’Œï¼Œç”¨æ¸©æ¶¦æœ¨è‰²ã€ä½é¥±å’Œè½¯è£…è¥é€ æ²»æ„ˆæ°›å›´ã€‚éšè—å¼æ”¶çº³ä¸æ— ä¸»ç¯è®¾è®¡ï¼Œè®©ç©ºé—´æ•´æ´é€šé€ï¼Œå…¼å…·ç¾å­¦ä¸å®ç”¨ã€‚åœ¨è¿™é‡Œï¼Œæ¯ä¸€å¤„ç»†èŠ‚éƒ½ä¸ºå½“ä»£ç”Ÿæ´»é‡èº«å®šåˆ¶ï¼Œè®©å®¶æˆä¸ºæ—¢èˆ’é€‚åˆæœ‰æ ¼è°ƒçš„ç²¾ç¥å±…æ‰€ã€‚
An old client's apartment, accustomed to the glitz and glamour, pursues simplicity and inner peace. The design is based on light wood and warm white, outlining the relaxed feel of modern urban life. The open layout integrating living, dining, and kitchen areas enhances elegance with marble and metal lines; the bedroom and study area return to a soft and gentle style, creating a healing atmosphere with warm wood tones and low-saturation soft furnishings. Hidden storage and a design without main lights make the space clean and transparent, combining aesthetics and practicality. Here, every detail is tailored for contemporary life, making the home a comfortable and stylish spiritual retreat.

å§å®¤å»¶ç»­æ•´ä½“è°ƒæ€§ï¼Œå¤å¤åŠç¯ã€ç¢èŠ±åºŠå“ä¸å¼§å½¢æŸœä½“å‘¼åº”æ³•å¼åŸºå› ï¼Œé»‘ç™½è‰²è°ƒä¸æš–æœ¨è´¨æ„Ÿå¹³è¡¡ä¼˜é›…ä¸æ¸©åº¦ã€‚ä»å…¬å…±ç©ºé—´çš„ä»ªå¼æ„Ÿåˆ°ç§åŸŸçš„æ²»æ„ˆæ„Ÿï¼Œæ¯ä¸€å¤„ç»†èŠ‚éƒ½åœ¨è¯‰è¯´ï¼šçœŸæ­£çš„å“è´¨å±…æ‰€ï¼Œæ˜¯è®©æµªæ¼«ä¸å®ç”¨å…±ç”Ÿï¼Œè®©ä¼˜é›…æˆä¸ºæ—¥å¸¸ã€‚
With French romance as its backbone and modern comfort as its soul, this large flat redefines the relaxed feel of urban luxury homes with delicate strokes.
The glass plant scenery at the entrance brings nature into the entryway; the carved ceiling and plaster line facade in the living room evoke a retro feel with symmetrical aesthetics, while the black and white contrast and curved softened lines make luxury feel less cold and rigid. The open social area connects to the cityscape, and the layout of the piano area and leisure sofa naturally bridges art and life.
The bedroom continues the overall tone, with vintage chandeliers, floral bedding, and curved cabinets echoing the French gene. The black and white palette and warm wood texture balance elegance and warmth. From the ritualistic feeling of the public space to the healing sensation of the private realm, every detail speaks: a truly quality residence is one where romance and practicality coexist, making elegance a daily part of life.

With Eastern Zen as its core and modern luxury as its form, this reception club redefines the spatial narrative of high-end business hospitality. The entranceâ€™s dry landscape installation, paired with a hammered metal ceiling, condenses the poetry of "still water reflecting the sky" into a compact space. Marble walls and display cabinets accented with red glaze infuse elegance and warmth into the black-and-white-gray palette. The reception area uses semi-transparent metal grilles to define spaces, with black-and-white color-blocked soft furnishings balancing privacy and transparency, making socializing both relaxed and ceremonial. The banquet area features a round marble table and crystal chandelier, with curved ceilings softening the luxurious texture, and semi-transparent partitions framing urban views, turning banquets into a feast for both sight and taste. The tea loungeâ€™s backlit red display cabinets showcase porcelain collections, while a fireplace adds warmth to business discussions. From the ceremonial entrance to the transparent banquet space, every design blends tradition and modernity to create a reception venue with cultural depth and comfort.
